entry.title: Best Paper award at SALAD workshop for "`grlc` Makes GitHub Taste Like Linked Data APIs"
entry.content:
We won a best paper award at the Services and Applications (SALAD) workshop, held in conjunction with ESWC 2016, for our paper on grlc.

Albert Meroño-Peñuela and Rinke Hoekstra, grlc Makes GitHub Taste Like Linked Data APIs

entry.title: Best Paper award at WHISE workshop for "An Ecosystem for Linked Humanities Data"
entry.content:
We won a best paper award at the Humanities and Semantic Web (WHISE) workshop, held in conjunction with ESWC 2016, for our paper on datalegend.

Rinke Hoekstra, Albert Meroño-Peñuela, Kathrin Dentler, Auke Rijpma, Richard Zijdeman and Ivo Zandhuis. An ecosystem for Linked Humanities Data. This was a shared award with:

Mikko Koho, Eero Hyvönen, Erkki Heino, Jouni Tuominen, Petri Leskinen, and Eetu Mäkelä. Linked Death—Representing, Publishing, and Using Second World War Death Records as Linked Open Data

entry.title: WP4: The structured DataHub: Linked Data, Big and Small
entry.content: Presentation given at the "Past, Present and Future of Digital Humanities & Social Sciences in the Netherlands" symposium, May 20th, 2016

entry.title: QBer - Connect your data to the cloud!
QBer in Action
entry.content: A screencast of QBer. An application that can be used to annotate and upload data to the Structured Data Hub .

entry.title: QBer - Crowd Based Coding and Harmonization
Sounding Board Meeting
entry.content: Presentation to the first sounding board group meeting, Feb 16th, 2015, by Richard Zijdeman
